:::{#intro-heading}

He is an alumni of the Top 500 Innovators program at Stanford University, worked in several institutions over the years incl. Hasso Plattner Institute in Potsdam, Josef Stefan Institute in Ljubljana, University of Notre Dame and University of Technology Sydney. He is the author of [Scikit-multilearn](http://scikit.ml) - a popular python library for multi-label classification, and [pqdm](https://github.com/niedakh/pqdm) - a parallel processing wrapper for tqdm.

Apart from multi-label classification, Piotr published papers concerning urban data, traffic analysis and bridging the gap between ASR and NLP in spoken language understanding systems. In his free time he is an urban activist in Wrocław - chairing the [Society of Beautification of the City of Wrocław](http://tumw.pl), and a member of Wrocław city [district council of Brochów](http://brochow.wroclaw.pl).

Recently he became a member of the international group which models coronavirus spread: [MOCOS](http://mocos.pl), which publishes regular reports about the state of the pandemic in Poland and also analysis of related phenomena.
